page.title: 05MAIDSTONE GENERAL
page.content:
Maidstone, country town of Kent, is situated at the foot of the North Downs. It is a commercial and communication centre as well as a prosperous market town. It centres around the River Medway and has many facilities e.g. Stoneborough shopping centre, Hazlitt Theatre, several musuems, a cinema, Mote Park (incorporating all sports facilities) also the popular Leeds Castle nearby. The town is twinned with Beauvais in Northern France. Maidstone's coat of arms contains a rampant lion and an guanadon (thought to be Maidstone's oldest inhabitant - now in the Natural History Museum).
Inhabitants - 131,000 (borough) - 71,800 (town)
Rateable Value - #16,521,896
